_comment: Mock Recipe Data for E2E Testing - This represents TRANSFORMED data returned by /api/v2/fetch-creation (NOT raw WordPress API response). The WordPress API only returns HTML in the 'instructions' field, but /api/v2/fetch-creation transforms it into a structured 'step' array of HowToStep objects. E2E tests mock /api/v2/fetch-creation (not WordPress API) because Playwright's browser-context mocking cannot intercept server-side HTTP requests. See tests/e2e/README.md for detailed explanation of this mocking strategy.
title: Test Chocolate Chip Cookies
author: Test Chef
description: Delicious homemade chocolate chip cookies perfect for testing. These cookies are soft, chewy, and loaded with chocolate chips!
instructions:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C). Line baking sheets with parchment paper.
  2. In a large bowl, cream together the butter and sugars until light and fluffy, about 3-4 minutes.
  3. Beat in the eggs one at a time, then stir in the vanilla extract. Let rest for 3 seconds.
  4. In a separate bowl, whisk together flour, baking soda, and salt.
  5. Gradually blend the dry ingredients into the creamed mixture.
  6. Stir in the chocolate chips until evenly distributed.
  7. Drop rounded tablespoons of dough onto the prepared baking sheets, spacing them 2 inches apart.
  8. Bake for 20-25 minutes, or until the edges are golden brown.
  9. Remove from oven and let cool on the baking sheet for 5 minutes before transferring to a wire rack.
  10. Allow to cool completely for 10-15 minutes before serving.
instructions_with_ads:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C). Line baking sheets with parchment paper.
  2. In a large bowl, cream together the butter and sugars until light and fluffy, about 3-4 minutes.
  3. Beat in the eggs one at a time, then stir in the vanilla extract. Let rest for 3 seconds.
  4. In a separate bowl, whisk together flour, baking soda, and salt.
  5. Gradually blend the dry ingredients into the creamed mixture.
  6. Stir in the chocolate chips until evenly distributed.
  7. Drop rounded tablespoons of dough onto the prepared baking sheets, spacing them 2 inches apart.
  8. Bake for 20-25 minutes, or until the edges are golden brown.
  9. Remove from oven and let cool on the baking sheet for 5 minutes before transferring to a wire rack.
  10. Allow to cool completely for 10-15 minutes before serving.
notes: For extra chewy cookies, slightly underbake them and let them finish cooking on the hot baking sheet.
keywords: chocolate chip cookies, homemade cookies, baking

step.text: Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C). Line baking sheets with parchment paper.
In a large bowl, cream together the butter and sugars until light and fluffy, about 3-4 minutes.
Beat in the eggs one at a time, then stir in the vanilla extract. Let rest for 3 seconds.
In a separate bowl, whisk together flour, baking soda, and salt.
Gradually blend the dry ingredients into the creamed mixture.
Stir in the chocolate chips until evenly distributed.
Drop rounded tablespoons of dough onto the prepared baking sheets, spacing them 2 inches apart.
Bake for 20-25 minutes, or until the edges are golden brown.
Remove from oven and let cool on the baking sheet for 5 minutes before transferring to a wire rack.
Allow to cool completely for 10-15 minutes before serving.
